subject: Learning
title: The Feynman Technique
description: A fast breakdown of The Feynman Technique for builders.

hook.text: Richard Feynman could explain quantum physics to a child. His secret was a deceptively simple technique.

buildup.text: Step 1: Choose a concept. Step 2: Explain it as if teaching a 12-year-old. Step 3: Find the gaps. Step 4: Simplify.

discovery.text: The technique works because explaining forces you to organize knowledge and expose hidden confusion.

twist.text: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it. The complexity reveals your ignorance.

climax.text: Each iteration deepens understanding. The gaps you find are exactly what you need to study next.

punchline.text: Teach it to learn it. Simplify it to master it.

quiz.question: Why does the Feynman Technique improve understanding?
options: Explaining concepts simply forces you to organize knowledge and find gaps
It only works for physics concepts
It replaces the need to read any source material
